result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew P. Loebbaka

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Andrew P. Loebbaka
Current: 2504 Maple Rd, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 08-10-2017)
Prior: 219 N. 2nd Avenue, Wausau, WI 54401

Glascock - $2571.45
(full amount of bill paid by the County and assessment added to case 14CM491)
(copy to party)
and Reimbursement to County - signed 4/27/15 - includes 14CM491, 14CM1595, 14CM1841, 14CM2019, 15CM185
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Case Called: 9:04am. INCLUDES 14CM491, 14CM1595, 14CM1841, 14CM2019,15CM185. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Zachary Glascock. *VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to DRI ct 2 (intentionally point firearm) 14CM491-crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 2 (bj/misd) 14CM1841-crt grants. State moves to DRI ct 2 (bj/misd) 14CM2019-crt grants.  State moves to DRI 15CM185- crt grants. PLEA: NO CONTEST - ct 1 (operate firearm while intox) 14CM491; ct 1 (bj/misd) 14CM1595; ct 1 (OWI-2nd) 14CM1841; ct 1 (bj/misd) 14CM2019. Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  State & Defense make statement. COURT ORDERS: SWH - 2 yrs probation, concurrent. CONDITIONS: Counseling; AODA; Absolute Sobriety; Random Breath Test; No possession of dangerous weapons; No contact with C.S.; 40 hrs Community Service; No Restitution; Court Costs; DNA Surcharge. 
COURT ORDERS Defendant to forfeit 9mm Lorcin gun in 14CM491. COURT ORDERS remainder of weapons returned to 3rd party, Scott Schwerin. 
COURT FURTHER ORDERS: 14CM1841- 60 days MCJ w/huber if eligible pursuant to jail criteria including community service; 37 days credit; $1,7000 inclusive cc; Any vehicle titled or registered in the defendant's name is subject to IID for 14 months, as is the defendant himself, and device to be installed; 14 months dl revocation; AODA. Adjourned: 9:25am.

Case called: 8:38am.  INCLUDES 14CM491, 14CM1595, 14CM1841, 14CM2019, 15CM185. Clerk: Denise. State appears by ADA Lisa Gramer for ADA Kyle Mayo. Defendant appears in custody and by Atty Zachary Glascock. Matter set on 14CM491 & 14CM1595 to forfeit bond. State indicates disagreement regarding $2,000 Cash bond on all files that was set at Initials yesterday. Defense in agreement if on all files. COURT notes cash bond is on all files. Crt will not forfeit bond. 
DATES: PTC 1/30/15 @ 10:50am. Adjourned: 8:40am.

INCLUDES 14CM491, 14CM1841, 14CM2019, 14CM1595, 15CM185.  Shall not drive a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.  No alcohol.  No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.  Contact Attic Correctional Services at 715-848-3202 - Day Report within 1 business day of release.    Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.  No contact with victim(s):  C.S.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
